fullDescription.intro:
Converts the url strings of the specified string flow variable into file path strings. Four string flow variables will be set. The first contains the complete file path, the second the parent folder of the file, the third contains the file name (without extension), and the last contains the file extension.
It can be specified whether the node will fail if an invalid url string occurs or a file location does not exist. If failing is switched off (default) empty strings will set as values for each output variable.
fullDescription.option: If checked, the name of the specified input variable is used as prefix for the names of the output variables.

option.name: Fail if URL has invalid syntax

fullDescription.option: If checked, node will fail if an invalid url string occurs, otherwise an empty string will be set as file path, parent folder, file name, and file extension variables.

option.name: Fail if file does not exist

fullDescription.option: If checked, node will fail if a file location does not exist, otherwise an empty string will set as file path parent folder, file name, and file extension variables.

ports.inPort: A string flow variable containing the url string to convert.
ports.outPort: Four additional string flow variables containing the file path, parent folder, the file name, and the file extension.
